div.p: TVOICENARRATION is available within WRITING TEXTUALFEATURES .It encloses a statement or discussion, and has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes. It addresses the question of how a story is told: who speaks (first-person, multiple voices, omniscient or unreliable narrator, interpolations, use of fictional documents, etc), and sometimes the character or situation of the narrator(s).

div.codeblock: <TVOICENARRATION>Because the novel is overpopulated with characters, the narrator intrudes sometimes inelegantly in order to keep the plot on track.</TVOICENARRATION> <TVOICENARRATION>As a matter of strategy, Anne Askew assumed a stance of humility, but stated her beliefs boldly and clearly.</TVOICENARRATION> <TVOICENARRATION>Joanna Baillie writes in this novel as an unlearned person to every unlearned reader of common understanding.</TVOICENARRATION>
